messages.message:
How do I figure out if a cluster is single tenant vs multi tenant AIHub?
`HOST_TENANT_ID` I see this one env variable used as - is this the right one?
```  # Tenant Mode
  - type: tenant-mode
    condition: "HOST_TENANT_ID == ''"
    hvfFileNames:
      - "tenant-mode/single-tenant.yaml"
  - type: tenant-mode
    condition: "HOST_TENANT_ID != ''"
    hvfFileNames:
      - "tenant-mode/multi-tenant.yaml"```
You can check on ICC, if itâ€™s a ST environment it will say Standalone on the tenant details page

I want to set the value of a hot config variable in hot-configs.yml
Specifically `TS_GROUP_CONFIGS`
Example:
deployment-configs/environment-patches/saas-advanced-patches/saas-hierarchial-patches/tenant/aihub-dev-deprecated/hot-configs-job-service.yml

I want to add a different default for MT vs ST - what would be the way to do this?
We have an env var `AIHUB_ORG_NAME` available in webapp, api-server, aihub-license post-install actions we can use. `AIHUB_ORG_NAME!=''` means it's ST

Single-tenant is an overloaded term - could mean single tenant infrastructure (standalone environment, does not rely on a host tenant for some resourcing) or ST AI Hub which is an AI Hub deployment type that only supports one customer
You could have a single-tenant infra + MT AI Hub environment like aihub.instabase.com (http://aihub.instabase.com), or a multi-tenant infra, ST AI Hub environment like many of our developer sandboxes
